sprite.name: Snake Block
sprite.notes:
Effects of various path node options:
Speed: Does nothing
Acceleration: Does nothing
Delay: Does nothing
Placement: Near the starting node
Angles: 45/90 degree lines only, see below.

Distance from the first path node to the next path node must be a flat line, AS WELL AS be able to accommodate the full length of the Snake Block. After that, any segment length, as well as diagonals, may be used.
When it encounters a diagonal line, the Snake Block will zigzag until it reaches the height, and then go straight, so a 45 degree angle is recommended if not having it travel in a straight line.

list.title: End Animation
list.comment:
When the Snake Block reaches the end of its path, it will deactivate, and do this.
Values 4+ will CRASH the game.

checkbox.title: Ice Snake Block (must be checked)
checkbox.comment: This causes the snake block to be icy instead of green. The green version is incomplete and crashes the game, so you MUST use an icy one.

value.title: Starting Node
value.comment: Node that the Snake Block starts on. Useful for, say, using it alongside auto-scroll.

list.title: Speed
list.comment: This value affects the speed of the Snake Block, but it seems to CRASH when some values are used.

value.title: Path ID
value.comment: The Path ID the Snake Block will use.

list.title: Length
list.comment: Value + 3

sprite.name: (Unused) En_Slip_Penguin
sprite.notes: Does nothing. Seems like it was an old version of the Cooligan.

sprite.name: Chestnut Goomba
sprite.notes:
Will yield a normal goomba if shot with a fireball. Also works with fireballs coming from Fire Bros. Does not work with fireballs coming from Fire Chomps.

Yoshi can't safely jump on this enemy, nor can he eat it. Yoshi can, however, defeat this enemy by spitting a fireball at it.

sprite.name: Power-Up in Bubble / Player in Bubble
sprite.notes:
This Sprite isn't intended to be used normally in levels - the game creates it when needed (only for Multiplayer).
It may CRASH the game if used with wrong/invalid settings! Can only spawn a Mushroom so far.

checkbox.title: Unknown Value 10 (Spawn Item or Player?)
checkbox.comment:
It is not possible to spawn an item other than a mushroom without asm hacks, because the item settings are hard coded.
Makes the Sprite appear if set to 1, but might do something else.
All other Values will CRASH the game. Maybe Nintendo planned more Items to be spawned with this, but did not reference them.

list.title: Appears at:
list.entry: Moves into screen from the right side
Sprite's placement in Reggie, or where the player is located

list.title: Type of player
list.comment: As usual, 0 = Mario, 1 = Luigi, 2 = Yellow Toad, 3 = Blue Toad. If the player is not playing, it crashes. If the player is playing, but is alive, this sprite does nothing. This is why it probably can't be used to spawn players.

value.title: Movement ID
value.comment: This functions as a movement controller. Known matched sprites - 147 (Coins), 207 (?-Blocks), 209 (Brick Blocks), 382 (Screw Mushroom Platform)

value.title: Unknown Value 7-8
value.comment: (S) Seems to be 7-8, unknown use. Nintendo uses 1 in 1-5 A1.

value.title: Distance Moved
value.comment: Number of blocks it will travel, maximum.

value.title: Unknown Value 11 (Speed?)
value.comment: (S) 0-15. Please test more values and report them at RVLution.net .

sprite.name: Giant Floating Log
sprite.notes: Yoshi does not work or interact with this sprite.

sprite.name: (Unused) One Way Swinging Gate
sprite.notes: This was used in 2-3 (Sewer) in New Super Mario Bros. DS. Like most other sprites ported from that game, this gate is shaded in dark. It opens only when you approach from a certain direction. It rotates 90° to open and 90° back after a second or so.

checkbox.title: Use Bar Type 2 (Counter-clockwise)
checkbox.comment: Will change the direction from which Mario can enter the gate.

list.title: Bar Type 1 (Opens Clockwise)
list.comment:
Determines the direction the player has to enter the gate for it to open.
Values 2 and 3 are slightly buggy.

list.title: Bar Type 2 (Opens Counter-Clockwise)
list.comment: Determines the direction the player has to enter the gate for it to open. Values 2 and 3 are slightly buggy.

sprite.name: Flying ? Block
sprite.notes: Yoshi: Mario can't open the Flying ? Block while riding Yoshi.

checkbox.title: Unknown Value 5
checkbox.comment: (S) 0-1 Used as 1 in 6-05 A2. Possibly distance related.

checkbox.title: Reverse Direction
checkbox.comment: If this is checked, it will travel the opposite direction upon level launch.

list.title: Block Contains
list.comment: The block will always hold a star, a 1-Up, and the item specified here.

sprite.name: Scale
sprite.notes: If the platform width is set to 13, 14 or 15, it won't behave correctly in game!

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: If Event Activated is set, the platform will be shown when this Event ID is activated.

list.title: Platform Width
list.comment: Value + 3; values 13-15 are glitchy

value.title: Rope Length - Left Side
value.comment: Starting length of the rope of the left platform

value.title: Rope Length - Right Side
value.comment: Starting length of the rope of the right platform

value.title: Rope Width
value.comment: Distance between the left and right platforms. Minimum is 1 (the green pulleys are next to each other)

sprite.name: Special Exit Controller
sprite.notes: The sprite's placement determines the upper-left corner of the warp area.

list.title: Exit Transition
list.comment:
This value determines the transition animation used when the screen fades out.
0: The screen will go black with a wavy line going from bottom to top.
1: The screen will go black with a wavy line going from top to bottom. The animation is not triggered immediately upon contact with the warp area, but a little bit later.
2: Same as 1, except that the warp is triggered immediately.
3: Looks just like any pipe exit, with a black circle enclosing Mario's position. At the same time, the sound effect that plays when Mario enters a normal pipe is played.
list.entry: Wavy Transition from Bottom to Top
Wavy Transition from Top to Bottom (Delayed)
Wavy Transition from Top to Bottom

checkbox.title: Beanstalk Exit
checkbox.comment: If this is checked, the warp will only occur if Mario is climbing on a beanstalk.

checkbox.title: Exit Stage (Walking Left)
checkbox.comment: If this is checked, the controller will force Mario to walk to the left and exit the stage with a black circle transition (no pipe noise). This does not complete the stage.

list.title: Width
list.comment: Value + 1, in blocks.

list.title: Height
list.comment: Value + 1, in blocks.

value.title: Exit ID
value.comment: This exit point's destination will be used for the warp.

value.title: Exit ID (Overflow)
value.comment: Part of the Exit ID setting. If the target Exit ID is 16 or greater, add 1 to this value for each 16, and place the remainder as the Exit ID.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: If this value is nonzero and the specified event is inactive, the warp cannot occur.

value.title: Location ID
value.comment: Cheep Cheeps will spawn from below (jumping) only while Mario is in this location.

sprite.name: Event Triggered Door
sprite.notes: Yoshi does not work or interact with this sprite.

list.title: Orientation (Buggy)
list.comment: Use with Rotation Controllers

checkbox.title: Rotation Controlled (Buggy)
checkbox.comment: Glitchy setting. Does not work very well if it's 'always spinning'.

value.title: Rotation ID
value.comment: Match with a Rotation Controller to cause this sprite to move.

sprite.name: (Unused) En_TarzanRope
sprite.notes: No code.

sprite.name: (Unused) Mask
sprite.notes: "Mask" refers to the secret Layer 0 areas. Maybe in the early stages of development, this sprite needed to be present in the level in order for Layer 0 to work (creating a dark circle around Mario).

sprite.name: Toad Balloon
sprite.notes:
Collecting 8 of these spawns a Toad House Chest. Requires an Ambush Controller (454) for the balloons to spawn.

Yoshi does not work or interact with this sprite.

sprite.name: Collision Switcher - Mini-Mario Only
sprite.notes: This sprite will switch the active collision layer from Layer 1 to Layer 2 and vice versa. See W1-3 A1. This sprite is actually two blocks wide.

sprite.name: Player Block
sprite.notes: This sprite is used with sprite 333.

value.title: Entrance ID
value.comment: Set this to the ID of the entry point where Mario will return if he dies.

list.title: Facing Direction
list.comment: If Mario dies, he will respawn facing the direction specified here.

sprite.name: Larry Koopa
sprite.notes:
If Yoshi is used: Yoshi is immune to all attacks from Larry (ramming attacks, Fireballs, etc.). Yoshi gets hit and runs away only if he touches Larry while he is invincible.

Yoshi does not work or interact with this sprite.

sprite.name: (Unused) Tilt Lift
sprite.notes: This uses the same 3D model as the used Tilt Lift, but this one has collisions that extend two blocks farther on the right side.

sprite.name: Tile God Event
sprite.notes: Creates / Changes / Destroys Tiles in a certain 'area'. Can create or destroy blocks after an event has been triggered, and much more.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: When this Event ID is activated, the tiles affected by the sprite's area will be created/destroyed (depending on the Mode).

checkbox.title: Permanent
checkbox.comment: If this option is checked, the effect of the sprite (creation / destruction) will remain even after the event is deactivated. If this is not checked, previously destroyed tiles will 'respawn' (with their 'Block Type' set) after the initial event is deactivated again.

list.title: Fill Pattern
list.comment: Determines the pattern the area will be filled with.

list.title: Object Type
list.comment:
Here you can select which object type will be used to fill the selected area.

Note: If an event is activated that triggers the 'Tile God' effect to destroy objects, and the event is deactivated afterward, then the area will be filled with the object type selected here (the 'Permanent' checkbox overrides this).

Tip: The number in parentheses () corresponds to the position of the tile in the tileset (tiles 0-255). Each tileset has 16 rows, each row has 16 tiles, and each tile is 24x24px. The number in the second parentheses () correspond to the object number if hovering in Reggie! over an object in the palette with your mouse cursor.

list.title: Effect
list.comment: Determines the effect that is triggered when the event is activated. 'Destroy Tiles' can destroy all kinds of objects. It cannot destroy sprites. 'Spawns Tiles' will even create new tiles above other tiles or objects.

value.title: Width
value.comment: Determines the width of the area that is affected.

value.title: Height
value.comment: Determines the height of the area that is affected.

sprite.name: Boss Controller - Larry Koopa
sprite.notes:
Used by Nintendo for the final boss battle in the World 1 castle. The Larry Koopa sprite is not required. This sprite controls various functions of the boss fight, such as Camera options.

If Yoshi is used: The same problems appear during the battle as in the tower fight (Larry's fire and ramming attacks are ineffective, etc.). The boss fight is however completely beatable, but only if Mario collects the key without riding Yoshi at that moment. Otherwise, time stands still and Mario and Yoshi are stuck in the room forever.

Yoshi does not work or interact with this sprite.

value.title: Movement Distance
value.comment: Probably in blocks.

value.title: Movement Distance
value.comment: Probably in blocks.

list.title: Shooting Speed / Direction
list.comment:
This is a very weird sprite...
Values marked with an asterisk (*) will cause the crab to shoot the projectile backward (right). Values marked with two asterisks (**) will cause the crab to shoot AND face backward (right).

sprite.name: Fish Bone
sprite.notes: Fish Bones does not function in anything but normal non-location-based water.

value.title: Possible Value 10
value.comment: (S) 0-15. No visible change. It's unclear if this has any function at all.

list.title: Start Direction
list.comment: Swims In Place: The Fish Bone will look into the camera, then (from this position) swim one block to the left. If Mario is close while the Fish Bone is swimming left, it will chase Mario while still facing the camera.

list.title: Switch Type/Star Coin Z-Order
list.comment: This nybble affects the sprite if nybble 12 is set to 1 (Star Coin) or 4 (P-Switch).
list.entry: P-Switch Upside-Down/Place Star Coin Behind Clampy

checkbox.title: Falls
checkbox.comment: Check this to allow the Clampy to be moved by gravity and environment things.

list.title: Contains
list.comment: Values 5 and higher crash the game upon level load.

list.title: Load-In-Animation
list.comment: Changes how the Grand Goomba appears on level load.
list.entry: Like it was just jumped on

sprite.name: Chest
sprite.notes:
Note that opening a chest will complete the level with the standard exit.

Exploit for lazy players: If Mario opens the chest but keeps on running until it goes offscreen (he does indeed have enough time to do this), the trunk will be closed again when he returns. When he returns to the chest, he can open it again! The insidious thing is that for each time Mario opens the chest, the item will be added to the inventory, again and again. This way you can get infinitely many items with just one chest...

Yoshi does not work or interact with this sprite.

value.title: Event ID
value.comment: The chest appears when this event is activated. It will never disappear, even when the event times out.

value.title: Unknown Value 5
value.comment: 0 or 1. No visible change. Used in ambushes in World 6.

list.title: Mushroom Reward Amount
list.comment: Value + 3. This will only affect the sprite if nybble 10 is set to 1 or 2. Specifying more than 5 mushrooms can cause glitchy behavior, but still works.

checkbox.title: Unknown Value 9
checkbox.comment: 0 or 1. No visible changed. Checked in all ambushes except those in Worlds 1 and 2.

list.title: Uses Ambush Controller
list.comment: REQUIRES SPRITE 454 OR 432 TO BE PRESENT. OTHERWISE THE LEVEL WILL CRASH. When set to 1, the chest will appear when all the toad balloons are collected in a level with an ambush controller.

list.title: Contains
list.comment:
Some values can cause a CRASH, if Toad (sprite 432) does not appear in the level.
(*): Works with the 'Mushroom Reward Amount' setting above.

sprite.name: Spiked Ball Spawner / Rolling Barrel Spawner

value.title: Disable Spawn Event
value.comment: Disables spawning of spiked balls when this event is activated. This only works if this sprite is set to 'Spiked Ball Spawner'.

list.title: Speed
list.comment: Changes the spawned items' speed and acceleration.

value.title: Number of Items Spawned
value.comment: 0 = infinite.

list.title: Grouping Mode
list.comment: Other values need to be tested. Also try to find out if there's a difference between values 3 and 4.
list.entry: Spawn three items, then long pause
Spawn three items, then short pause
Spawn one item, then long pause
Spawn one item, then long pause

sprite.name: Water Ball
sprite.notes: Warning: The game will CRASH if sprite 317 (Water Controller - Enables Bubbles) is missing from the zone.

value.title: Movement ID
value.comment: Match with other Movement IDs to make those sprites move.

value.title: Distance Moved
value.comment: Probably in blocks.

sprite.name: Zoom Controller
sprite.notes:
Forms an 'area' where the zoom of the camera changes when Mario enters it. The sprite's placement represents the lower left corner of this 'area'. These zoom levels (select them under 'Zone Settings') have the following sizes:
Zoom Level -2: 7x12.5 blocks
Zoom Level -1: 10.5x18.75 blocks
Zoom Level 0: 14x24.75 blocks
Zoom Level 1: 17x30.25 blocks, or 16x28.5 blocks
Zoom Level 2: 20x35.56 blocks, or 19x33.75 blocks
Zoom Level 3: 24x42.67 blocks, or 20x35.5 blocks
Zoom Level 4: 28x49.75 blocks

list.title: Screen Height
list.comment:
Determines the height the screen will expand to when Mario enters the sprite's area. The original zoom level is specified first (before the colon) and the effect after it. Different effects for different zoom levels are separated by semicolons. If using the zone Bias flag together with either value 3 or 11, then the height of the screen will change: for zoom level 0, it will be 24 blocks, and for 1 or 2 it will be 28 blocks. Other values are not affected.
Values with an asterisk (*) have an odd transition animation involved: when Mario enters the area, the screen height will be immediately set to 10 blocks shorter than the final height will be. It then grows to the correct size. When Mario leaves, the process is reversed.

Values are measured in blocks.

checkbox.title: Unknown Flag 5
checkbox.comment: (S) 0 or 1. No visible change.

list.title: Unknown Value 6
list.comment: (S) 0-3. Not yet tested.

value.title: Affected Height
value.comment: In blocks, from the sprite's position. Note that the sprite's affected area is calculated with it being at the bottom left corner - so if you want to affect a 16-block high area, you would set this value to 16 and place the sprite at the bottom left corner of that area.

value.title: Affected Width

sprite.notes: Flag x08. Seems to have no data associated with it. Probably incomplete.

sprite.name: Boss Controller - Bowser Jr. (1st Battle)
sprite.notes:
If Yoshi is used: The fight will not start as long as the player rides Yoshi. During the whole fight, Yoshi cannot move, but Bowser Jr. cannot hit Mario while he sits on Yoshi. With Yoshi in the level, Bowser Jr. can be hit even before he jumps into his clown copter. Damage can be inflicted with a jump / ramming attack, something that would not work without Yoshi in the level.
The negative effect of this 'Pre Attack' is that the Boss (Cutscene and Ending Related) Controller for the Bowser Jr. Fight (sprite 409) then turns off and thus continues the fight without this Boss Controller.
One side effect of the failure of the Boss Controller is that Bowser Jr. will fly very 'low' with his clown copter. The boss fight can end, but not while sitting on Yoshi. And when you sit on Yoshi while Bowser Jr. falls after his defeat, you can hear the victory music, but nothing else happens. Mario is stuck in the room forever and a reset is needed.
This fight may be playable without the boss controller.

Yoshi does not work or interact with this sprite.

value.title: Z-Order
value.comment: If you have multiple hills overlapping each other, you can use this value to prevent graphics glitches. Hills with a higher Z-order number will show behind hills with a lower number.

sprite.name: Poisoned Water
sprite.notes:
Same settings as water. It can definitely be tricked by events to bring the poisoned water surface back to the starting point (except probably mode 9+).

It's also possible to get rising / falling poisoned water involving locations. If Mario or an enemy is touching a location, the poisoned water will fall. It will then rise back up again when Mario/enemy leaves the location.

Furthermore, the poisoned water can also automatically rise the specified number of blocks up and down with self-defined delay periods, regardless of locations. This works by switching the Event ID on and off in the right intervals. If the given Event ID is activated, the poisoned will rise the given number of blocks. If the Event ID is deactivated, the poisoned water will fall again, but only if it has already reached the end of its Rising / Falling distance. Through an event system with at least 4 event controllers it is therefore possible to build a system that activates and deactivates the given Event ID indefinitely. A correct duration must of course be set for the event controllers.

Yoshi does not work or interact with this sprite.

list.title: Mode
list.comment:
The same options as water and lava.

Tip: Unfortunately, this option does not work properly. It has some flaws. The main problem is that this option only works in ONE zone, while affecting all poisoned water sprites in this zone. If a second sprite is used in another zone with a greater Y-value, the lower zone will be completely filled with poisoned water.

All values marked with an asterisk (*) work in a particular way: When the appropriate event has not been activated, or there is no corresponding event, then the poisoned water surface will appear higher. This can be set with the option 'Distance'. The poisoned water will then sink this many blocks, respecting the delay. After waiting for the delay at the bottom, the poisoned water surface will not rise again, but instead 'skip' the rising part and 'jump' to the top.

Using this with events will cause the poisoned water to rise, instead of falling. But the starting point is the same as with the sinking behavior. The difference is that the poisoned water rises continuously as long as the event is enabled. If it is disabled, the poisoned water surface will be right back where the poisoned water has started to rise and remain there until the event is re-enabled.

Using sprites with and without an asterisk (*) together (and both have 'Distance' set) in the same zone could cause the game to CRASH!!

checkbox.title: Falling
checkbox.comment:
The poisoned water behaves normally if this box is not selected. By selecting this checkbox, a value of 8-15 for the Falling / Rising rate is used.
More information about the 'Falling' mode is also available in the Notes section and the notes for the 'Mode' option.

value.title: Delay at Bottom
value.comment: How long the poisoned water stops after rising.

value.title: Delay at Top
value.comment: How long the poisoned water stops after falling. Initial delay only can be set by using event-controlled poisoned water. Simply use an Event Chainer sprite which triggers the poisoned water movement after a specific amount of time.

value.title: Distance
value.comment: Amount of blocks the poisoned water will rise.

checkbox.title: Flat Top
checkbox.comment: Checking this removes the animated crest effect on the top portion of the sprite. Creates a 'square' look. Recommended use only with a straight ceiling.

checkbox.title: Place behind Layer 0
checkbox.comment: Alters the Z-order slightly. Only affects location-based poisoned water. In order for this to work properly, the zone must be set to "Normal" in the visibility settings.

value.title: Location ID
value.comment:
Match with a location to set the area of this sprite. Only works with Location IDs 0-127. Location IDs 128-255 will cause the poisoned water to constantly move up and down slightly.
Please note, setting this value to 0 will produce so-called 'non-location-based poisoned water'.
Setting it to any other value will create 'location-based poisoned water'. Both have unique features. Location-based poisoned water can alter its Z-index, thus appearing behind other sprites or objects. Etc.

value.title: Unknown Value 10
value.comment: 0 or 1

sprite.name: Stretch Block
sprite.notes: A sprite that creates a horizontal line of orange blocks. The line contracts and expands by moving up and down. The greater value of nybbles 11 and 12 determines the number of blocks used to create the line.

value.title: Stretch Block ID
value.comment: Links with sprite 312.

value.title: Movement Distance
value.comment: Determines how far the Stretch Block moves up or down when contracting or expanding (in blocks). The speed is constant - longer distances will take longer to travel. Because the growing/shrinking is accomplished in the same time that it takes the Stretch Block to travel up or down, if the movement distance is 0, the Stretch Block grows/shrinks immediately.

value.title: Width (Top)

value.title: Width (Bottom)

list.title: Formation Type
list.comment:
Sets the formation type. The Direction, in which the formation points, is set by the swimming Direction. Cheep Cheep formations that swim to the right will appear mirrored, IE the arrow formation would point to the right instead to the left. All Values ​​after 4 are exactly the same. The arrow formation Value of 1 is different from the remaining ones. It always includes 3 Cheep Cheeps, no matter what else has been set.
Values with an asterisk (*): This simply means that the number of Cheep Cheeps is ignored (with always only 1 Cheep Cheep per row) when 'Stretch Vertically' is enabled.

Original position:
0, 1, ≥ 5 - The Sprite's placement represents the peak of the arrow formation.
Value 2 - The Sprite's placement represents the topmost Cheep Cheep in the first row.
Value 3, 4 - The Sprite's placement represents the Cheep Cheep that swims in first place.

list.title: Formation Repeat
list.comment: Value + 1. Sets how many groups (rows) appear in succession. 0 = 1 group, 1 = 2 groups with the same pattern appear one after the other, 2 = 3 groups, etc. For groups with an arrow pattern (0 ≥ 5, 1) there is a space of 3 Blocks between groups. For other Values (2, 3, 4) there is only 1 Block of free space between two groups.

list.title: Cheep Cheeps per Formation
list.comment: Value + 1. Number of Cheep Cheeps in a row of each formation (pattern). Every new Cheep Cheeps will either be placed under the last Cheep Cheep (Formation: 2) or after the last Cheep Cheep with a shift on the Y-axis (Formation: 0, 1, 3, 4, 5). The vertical and horizontal distance between the new and the previous Cheep Cheep is one Block. Only for the arrow formations, the shift of the next Cheep Cheeps on the Y-axis is halved.

checkbox.title: Swims left
checkbox.comment: The Sprite will only spawn correctly if its Direction is the opposite of the one Mario will approach it with.

checkbox.title: Stretch Vertically
checkbox.comment: This option determines the displacement of the individual Cheep Cheeps on the Y-axis. If this option is selected, the vertical spacing varies between adjacent Cheep Cheeps It changes periodically (IE, repeatedly) between 0 Blocks and one Block back and forth. The Cheep Cheep will swims straight at the height of the Sprite's placement. Needs about 6 ticks of the level's clock for one pass (IE, once back and forth).

sprite.name: X Axis Scroll Stop (Top)
sprite.notes: The same Values ​​are listed as for the other type of Scroll Limit (162, 163, 164, 165). Requires the bottom Sprite (249), which must be placed below this Sprite (on the same vertical line). As long as Mario is in the height between these two Sprites, the Screen does not scroll past this virtual line. Unfortunately, it is only possible to limit the Scrolling to the right, not the left side.

Hitting this ?-Block will turn off the linked Event. It has to finish rotating (stand idle) to perform its function. Hitting it during rotation won't work.

Tip: With this Sprite you can create stationary, angled Pipes ('Pipe Slopes') like those in prior Mario games. See 'Direction'.

list.title: Direction

value.title: Tilt Angle

If Coins and Blocks are involved, they will appear before the Event is triggered, but will not move until the Event is turned on. Once turned on, their movement cannot be stopped. Platform Blocks are 'off' until the Event is activated, though.
Note: Even invisible Blocks work with this Controller.

sprite.name: Rising / Falling Water
sprite.notes: Water specifically designed to rise and fall. The difference to normal water is a uniform height. I.e. this Sprite is only two 'water Blocks' deep ('Depth of Water' = 0), that hovers up and down. You can specifically set the depth of water. Below this specified depth, it ceases, IE below it is nothing. Unfortunately, there is no transition from water to air, and therefore be careful with the Values or else it looks 'wrong'.

value.title: Triggering Event ID

checkbox.title: Falls*
checkbox.comment: With this activated, the water moves downward rather than upward and then returns to its starting position.

list.title: Speed

In contrary to 'normal' water, Poison water and Lava, all Values work PERFECTLY for this Sprite. Values 3-7 are pretty similar to each other. The water movement increases only slightly per Value.
The Values ​​8-15 marked with an asterisk (*) result in the same movement speeds ​​as 0-7 do, but they cause the water to fall first instead of rising.

sprite.name: Line Controlled Player-Block Platform
sprite.notes: This Sprite is used with 187 (Player Block).

sprite.name: Big Cheep Cheep / Big Deep Cheep / Big Eep Cheep
sprite.notes: Same options as 'normal' Cheep Cheep (115), same values.

checkbox.title: Swims Left
checkbox.comment: If checked, swims to the left. The fish will not swim backwards when you backtrack. If unchecked, it depends on the 'Type' set, in which Direction the Cheep Cheep swims first. For Types 3, 4, 6 and 7, it swims to the right in general. All other Types will cause the Cheep Cheeps to swim in Mario's Direction.

list.title: Swim Speed
list.comment:
0-3. Values 3+ are identical with 3.
Note: Type-3 Cheep Cheeps (Swims Left / Right) have the same speed for Values 1 and 2.

list.title: Swim Distance
list.comment: Value + 1 in Blocks. Only valid for Cheep Cheeps with 'Type' 3 (Swims Left / Right). Distance calculated from Sprite's placement in both directions.

list.title: Type
list.comment:
Specifies the Swimming-'Type' that should be used for this Cheep Cheep. Deep Cheeps and Eep Cheeps only work in non-Location water. Value 5 is unique. Type-5 Cheep Cheeps will look into the camera until Mario comes close. Furthermore, the Direction will be ignored and the Cheep Cheep will always swim in the opposite Direction, away from Mario, but only if Mario is close enough.
Values marked with an asterisk (*) will ignore the speed Value set and instead will always use Value 1, no matter what is selected there. Also, all Values with (*) will let the Cheep Cheep swim in a wavy line (just as the Coin Cheep Cheep does).
The two Values with (**) follow exactly the same behavior as those marked with (*), only difference is its speed. Cheep Cheeps affected will swim slightly faster, both vertical and horizontal.

New naming scheme as of NSMBU:

Red = Cheep Cheep (normal)
Green = Deep Cheep (aggressive)
Yellow = Eep Cheep (shy)
list.entry: Big Cheep Cheep ("LrSwim"), Swims Left / Right
Big Cheep Cheep ("WaterWait"), Waits, Then Swims Straight**
Big Deep Cheep ("SrcSwim"), Follows Player Slightly*
Big Deep Cheep ("ScrSwim"), Follows Player Slightly*

value.title: 'Dodge' Event ID
value.comment:
Right, this does look weird at first glance, but it seems as if this function should work. It definitely has to do with Type 3 (Swims Left / Right). Treeki wrote this: 'LrSwim (Type 3) accepts an Event that will make the Cheep Cheep follow the player (turning state LrSwim into state LrSrcSwim)'.
If it really works is a good question.

sprite.name: School of Cheep Cheeps
sprite.notes: Creates a group of four Cheep Cheeps.

checkbox.title: Swims Left
checkbox.comment: If unchecked, each individual Cheep Cheep will swim toward Mario.

checkbox.title: Slower
checkbox.comment: Each Cheep Cheep has two determined speeds. The Cheep Cheep will 'toggle' between them. With this checked, both speeds will be much slower.

value.title: # of Giant Cheep Cheeps
value.comment: Max. of 4. Determines number of Giant Cheep Cheeps per School.

value.title: Cheep Cheep Formation Type
value.comment:
Value 0 uses a random formation between 0 and 3.
So there are 4 different formations.
0 = Possible Formation 1 (RANDOM)
1 = Possible Formation 2
2 = Possible Formation 3
3 = Possible Formation 4

All swarms with the same Value should produce exactly the same pattern/formation (excluding 0). In addition, a Value 4 formation always makes sure that all Cheep Cheeps in this swarm have the same speed.
Formation Type with Flags:
Value + 0 (from Flag) = Possible Formation 1 (RANDOM)
Value + 1 (from Flag) = Possible Formation 2
Value + 2 (from Flag) = Possible Formation 3
Value + 3 (from Flag) = Possible Formation 4
Not all formations work flawless, e.g. Value 2 variants have some problems.

list.title: Formation Type without Flag
list.comment: The Sprite's placement represents the topmost Cheep Cheep from the group. This is valid for all Formation Types. Value 1 and 2: Cheep Cheeps will swim in an uneven line. Values 3-15 = 2. Distance between Cheep Cheeps is generally small.

checkbox.title: Use Flag 4
checkbox.comment:
Determines the spacing between individual Cheep Cheeps for the Flag 8 Formation Types.
Value 0: Medium Spacing
Value 1: Very Short Spacing
Value 2: Short Spacing

list.title: Formation Type for Flag 4
list.comment: The Sprite's placement represents the bottom-most Cheep Cheep from the group. This is valid for all Formation Types. Value 1 and 2: Cheep Cheeps will swim in an uneven line. Values 3-15 = 2.

checkbox.title: Use Flag 8
checkbox.comment: Resembles the normal Formations without a Flag set. Value 2 is very strange regarding its shape.

list.title: Formation Type for Flag 8
list.comment: For Values 0 and 1, the Sprite's placement represents the bottom-most respectively first Cheep Cheep from the group. For Value 2, the Sprite's placement is located 5 Blocks above the bottom-most Cheep Cheep. Values 3-15 = 2.

list.title: Formation Type for Flag 12
list.comment:
Flag 12 is a combination of Flag 4 and 8.
Value 0: Spacing is very small
Value 1: Spacing is small
Value 2: spacing is inconsistent.

For Values 0 and 1, the Sprite's placement represents the bottom-most respectively last Cheep Cheep from the group. or Value 2, the Sprite's placement is located 5 Blocks below the second Cheep Cheep fro the second line. Values 3-15 = 2.

sprite.name: Boss Controller - Morton Koopa
sprite.notes:
Used by Nintendo for the final Boss battle in the castle. Another Koopaling Sprite is not required. This Sprite controls various functions of the Boss fight, e.g. Camera options.

If Yoshi is used: The same problems appear during the battle, just like with the Tower fight (Larry's Fire and ramming attacks are ineffective, etc.). The Boss fight is however completely beatable, but only if Mario collects the Boss Key without riding Yoshi in this very second. Otherwise, time stands still and Mario and Yoshi are caught in the room forever.

sprite.name: Brown Tower Block

If Value 0-3 is used for Nybble 6 of every Block, they all will begin to move to their start Direction without Delay (that means at the same time) when they are loaded.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: Block is not instantly deactivated. However, if it leaves the Screen, it does not respawn if the triggering Event is off.

list.title: Movement Direction/First Delay

checkbox.title: Start Delay
checkbox.comment: "Flag 8": If checked, the Platform will wait 2 ticks from the level's clock until it moves. After the initial movement has occurred, it becomes irrelevant.

value.title: Delay Before Going Right/Up
value.comment: Sets how long it will stop for after moving right/up. Value : 2 ticks from the level's clock. Value rises evenly.

value.title: Delay Before Going Left/Down
value.comment: Sets how long it will stop for after moving left/down. Value : 2 ticks from the level's clock. Value rises evenly.

value.title: Distance Moved
value.comment: How many tiles the Block will move out before it returns to its start point

list.title: Height

sprite.name: Boss Controller - Tower Boss
sprite.notes:
Can't be placed inside wall tiles. Not quite sure how this Controller interacts with other Sprites.

If Yoshi is used: Does not work with Yoshi, provided that the fight does not stop when you defeat the Tower boss with a Ground Pound. Info: Yoshi is immune to all attacks (ramming attacks, Fireballs, etc.). The player takes damage only when he touches the Koopaling from the side. The only way to quit the level is by losing 1-Up or by exiting the level via the Pause Menu.
It is quite funny to mention, that Mario will lose a 1-Up if he jumps off Yoshi after the Koopaling has been defeated (or after the counter has reached 0).

Yoshi does not work or interact with this sprite.

list.title: Tower Boss
list.comment:
Requires an actual Koopaling Sprite in the same Zone to work. See Notes for Sprite 407.

If Yoshi is used: Values marked with an asterisk (*) CRASH the game, if Yoshi is used for the battle.

sprite.name: Boss Controller - Roy Koopa
sprite.notes:
Used by Nintendo for the final Boss battle in the castle. Another Koopaling Sprite is not required. This Sprite controls various functions of the Boss fight, e.g. Camera options.

If Yoshi is used: The same problems appear during the battle, just like with the Tower fight (Roy's Fire and ramming attacks are ineffective, etc.). The Boss fight is however completely beatable, but only if Mario collects the Boss Key without riding Yoshi in this very second. Otherwise, time stands still and Mario and Yoshi are caught in the room forever.)

Yoshi does not work or interact with this sprite.

value.comment: In Blocks. Determines the distance from the Coin to the surface of the Rolling Hill.

value.title: Spacing - Major Parts
value.comment: Every Rolling Hill (360#176;) can be divided into 16 22.5#176; parts. The first part starts at the Sprite's placement, the second part starts right from the first part, and so on (clockwise).

value.title: Spacing - Sub Parts
value.comment: Divides every 'major' part into 16 smaller 'Sub' parts. Value 0 places the Coin at the beginning of each major part, while 15 places it at the end. Recommended: Use multiples of 4 to avoid Coin overlapping. Each Value = 1.40625#176;.

sprite.name: Boss Controller - Iggy Koopa
sprite.notes:
Used by Nintendo for the final Boss battle in the castle. Another Koopaling Sprite is not required. This Sprite controls various functions of the Boss fight, e.g. Camera options.

If Yoshi is used: The same problems appear during the battle, just like with the Tower fight (Iggy's Fire and ramming attacks are ineffective, etc.). The Boss fight is however completely beatable, but only if Mario collects the Boss Key without riding Yoshi in this very second. Otherwise, time stands still and Mario and Yoshi are caught in the room forever.)
Info: Get off of Yoshi at the Entrance to the battle (before triggering the fight). Then, trigger the fight by walking to the middle of the Screen. Now, quickly go back and jump on Yoshi. If you're too slow, Yoshi will be paralyzed.

The same problems appear during the battle, just like with the Tower fight (Wendy's Fire and ramming attacks are ineffective, etc.). The Boss fight is however completely beatable, but only if Mario collects the Boss Key without riding Yoshi in this very second. Otherwise, time stands still and Mario and Yoshi are caught in the room forever.)

sprite.name: Spiny Cheep Cheep
sprite.notes: Same properties as "Cheep Cheep" 115

value.title: 'Escape' Event ID
value.comment: Spiny Cheep Cheep will escape, when this Event ID is activated ("EscapeSwim"). Only works, if the Spiny Cheep Cheep is currently chasing Mario. It will reappear at its origin after this Event ID has been deactivated.

checkbox.title: Swims Left
checkbox.comment: If checked, swims to the left. The fish will not swim backwards when you backtrack. If unchecked, it depends on the 'Type' set, in which Direction the Cheep Cheep swims first. For Types 3, 4, 6 and 7, it swims to the right in general. All other Types will cause the Cheep Cheeps to swim in Mario's Direction.

list.title: Swim Speed
list.comment:
0-3. Values 3+ are identical with 3.
Note: Type-3 Cheep Cheeps (Swims Left / Right) have the same speed for Values 1 and 2.

list.title: Swim Distance
list.comment: Value + 1 in Blocks. Only valid for Cheep Cheeps with 'Type' 3 (Swims Left / Right). Distance calculated from Sprite's placement in both directions.

list.title: Type
list.comment:
Specifies the Swimming-'Type' that should be used for this Cheep Cheep. Deep Cheeps and Eep Cheeps only work in non-Location water. Value 5 is unique. Type-5 Cheep Cheeps will look into the camera until Mario comes close. Furthermore, the Direction will be ignored and the Cheep Cheep will always swim in the opposite Direction, away from Mario, if Mario is close enough.
Values marked with an asterisk (*) will ignore the speed Value set and instead will always use Value 1, no matter what is selected there. Also, all Values with (*) will let the Cheep Cheep swim in a wavy line (just as the Coin Cheep Cheep does).
The two Values with (**) follow exactly the same behavior as those marked with (*), only difference is its speed. Cheep Cheeps affected will swim slightly faster, both vertical and horizontal.

list.title: Movement Direction
list.comment: Will move in the specified Direction, when enough Sprites are on it. It will return to its initial position afterwards.

value.title: Movement Speed
value.comment: Determines the speed this Platform will move, when enough Sprites are on it.

sprite.name: Boss Controller - Bowser Jr. 2nd Battle
sprite.notes:
If Yoshi is used: The fight will not start as long as the player rides Yoshi. During the whole fight, Yoshi is not capable to move, but Bowser Jr. cannot hit Mario while he sits on Yoshi. With Yoshi in the level, Bowser Jr. can be hit, even before he jumped into his 'Clown Copter'. Damage can be inflicted with a jump / ramming attack, something that would not work without Yoshi in the level. The negative effect of this 'Pre Attack' is that the Boss (Cutscene and Ending Related) Controller for the Bowser Jr. Fight (409) then turns off and thus continues the fight without this Boss Controller. Side effects for the failure of the Boss Controller is that Bowser Jr. will fly very 'low' with his Clown Copter... The Boss fight can end, but not while sitting on Yoshi. And when you sit on Yoshi while Bowser Jr. falls after his defeat, you can hear the victory fanfare, but nothing else happens. Mario is caught in the room and a reset is needed.
By the way: I actually believe that this fight is playable even without a matching Boss Controller in a normal level...

Yoshi does not work or interact with this sprite.

With Yoshi in the level, Bowser Jr. can be hit, even before he jumped into his 'Clown Copter'. Damage can be inflicted with a jump / ramming attack, something that would not work without Yoshi in the level. The negative effect of this 'Pre Attack' is that the Boss (Cutscene and Ending Related) Controller for the Bowser Jr. Fight (409) then turns off and thus continues the fight without this Boss Controller. Side effects for the failure of the Boss Controller is that Bowser Jr. will fly very 'low' with his Clown Copter... The Boss fight can end, but not while sitting on Yoshi. And when you sit on Yoshi while Bowser Jr. falls after his defeat, you can hear the victory fanfare, but nothing else happens. Mario is caught in the room and a reset is needed.
By the way: I actually believe that this fight is playable even without a matching Boss Controller in a normal level...

checkbox.comment: 0-1. No visible change. Used in 8-04 A2. Probably used to force the Spike to throw balls even while offscreen.

list.title: Type
list.comment: Stone Spikes throw boulders straight down, while regular Spikes throw spike balls to the side. They also have differing colors.

sprite.name: (Unused) Boss Controller - Larry Koopa
sprite.notes: Considered incomplete. Does not want to do anything, even with a Tower Boss Controller or a Cutscene Controller attached. You can still put this Sprite in a normal level and Larry will appear at the Sprite's placement. He can be defeated with Fire and Ice. If Mario jumps on him, Mario will get hit. Nonetheless, Mario can do a Ground Pound to defeat him immediately. This Sprite was perhaps created to give the possibility to place Larry normally in a level. He just stands there and waits...

sprite.name: Invisible 1-Up - Mini-Mario Only
sprite.notes: Sprite enables collection of an invisible 1-Up when passed over by Mini-Mario (see W1-3 A1). Sprite seems to have no other options.

sprite.name: Invisible Spin-Jump Coin
sprite.notes: A Coin appears if you spin-jump near this Sprite, similar to the effect of spin-jumping near a dancing flower.

sprite.name: Missile Banzai Bill Generator
sprite.notes: This sprite spawns endless Missle Banzai Bills. It doesn't use a Cannon, they just appear out of nowhere (from the Sprite's placement).

value.title: Delay Between Firing
value.comment: 16-24 Recommended. The higher the Value, the slower the spawn rate.

sprite.name: Bowser
sprite.notes:
Should not be used without the 'Bowser Boss Controller'. Without this Controller, the player (with or without Yoshi) will simply 'pass through' Bowser as if he were background.

If Yoshi is used: Bowser's Fire Balls will pass through Yoshi. If Mega-Bowser hits Mario riding on Yoshi, Mario will take damage but will stay on Yoshi.

Yoshi does not work or interact with this sprite.

sprite.name: Lighting - Giant Glow Block
sprite.notes: REQUIRES an Event ID and a Movement Controller to work properly.

list.title: Glow Type
list.comment: If set to 0, it will be lit from the start, if to 1, it will be possible to Event-activate it, but it will stay lit even if the Event gets deactivated, if set to 2, it will be possible to activate it with Event, but it will go dark if the Event expires/gets deactivated.

value.title: Movement ID
value.comment: Known used Sprites: Movement Controller - Use Paths (159).

sprite.name: (Unused) Fake Ghost Door
sprite.notes:
This Sprite's functionality is part of Ghost House Door by default. This is the "Fake Door".

Yoshi does not work or interact with this sprite.

sprite.name: ? Block with Toad (Single Player)
sprite.notes: Not used by Nintendo, but works flawless. Up to 3 Toads can spawn.

checkbox.title: Unknown Value 12
checkbox.comment:
(S) 0-1.

While carrying Toad, Mario can enter a SEC (Special Exit Controller). When Mario enters the 'warping location', he throws Toad away slightly.

sprite.name: Brick Block with Toad (Single Player)
sprite.notes: Not used by Nintendo, but works flawless. Up to 3 Toads can spawn.

checkbox.title: Unknown Value 12
checkbox.comment:
(S) 0-1.

While carrying Toad, Mario can enter a SEC (Special Exit Controller). When Mario enters the 'warping location', he throws Toad away slightly..

list.title: Height
list.comment: From 0 to 7 - the resulting tree will be value + 4 blocks high.

sprite.name: Jellybeam
sprite.notes: Warning: Set to 'Full Darkness' under Zone Settings or else only huge white Squares will spawn. This will cause many BUGS.

list.title: Delay Before Dropping
list.comment: Jellybeam will take longer to start going down

value.title: Distance Dropped
value.comment: Additional distance dropped beyond its base Value, repeats after 0-3.

sprite.name: Fireball Spawn Area
sprite.notes: The position of this Sprite determines the Location the Fireballs spawn at. Fireballs move across a horizontal line.

list.title: Rate of Fire
list.comment: Frequency of Fireball spawns. Value 1 spawns constantly, and all other Values are fractionally less often. Nintendo uses 12 and 14

value.title: Location ID
value.comment: Spawns Fireballs while Mario is in this Location.

sprite.name: Kamek
sprite.notes:
If Yoshi is used: Kamek's Fireballs have no effect on Mario, while he rides on Yoshi. Kamek can be defeated with a Yoshi Ground Pound.

Yoshi does not work or interact with this sprite.

sprite.name: Toad House - Minigame Flip Panel
sprite.notes: Can be used to create Items for 6 different Flip Panel Minigames. Nintendo uses only 2-3 different Items per Panel.

value.title: Panel Number
value.comment: Row 1 - 0-5, Row 2 - 6-11, Row 3 - 12-17. Don't skip a number.

sprite.name: Final Boss Room Camera, Sound Effect and Boss Controller
sprite.notes:
"Boss_Koopa_Demo", no Values. Affects the camera of the final boss Zone, including zoom and position. Also adds the "Lava Rumbling" effect. Is required to trigger the shutter, and, therefore, the boss.

If Yoshi is used: Works with Yoshi, but he is immune against Fire Balls and Lava Waves. He will not run away when hit. Mario will take damage though. Mario has to get off Yoshi before touching any of the Switches. Tested with Dolphin.

Yoshi does not work or interact with this sprite.

sprite.name: (Unused) Floating ? Block
sprite.notes: Floats on the surface of water, lava, or poison.

list.title: Inscription
list.comment: Determines, which Label will be shown on the Cannon. Does not modify where Mario is sent to.

sprite.name: Ghost Fog
sprite.notes: Can be placed with or without a Location ID. Creates a thin wispy fog effect that moves horizontally over the Screen. Could support a Flag 10 with Value 4, like water. Could cause fog to be placed on Layer 0. Not tested.

sprite.name: View Related - "Background Centering"
sprite.notes: Will center the background at the Sprite's placement.

list.title: Y-Position
list.comment: 0, 1, 2 "Bg_Center";, more Values? Will determine the horizontal position of the background. 0 will center the background at Mario's position. Nintendo uses 1 for Boss Fights, 2 is used for the Bowser Fight.

sprite.name: Purple Striped Climbable Pole
sprite.notes:
Same functions as Climbable Pole from the Ghosthouse Tileset. Acts like an object. Must be placed 'evenly' in a grid. If not, Mario's Animation is off by .5 a tile.

Yoshi does not work or interact with this sprite.

value.title: Rotation ID
value.comment: Match with a Rotation Controller to make this Sprite move.

sprite.name: Horizontal Rope
sprite.notes: Yoshi does not work or interact with this sprite.

value.title: Length
value.comment: Up to 63

checkbox.title: Place In Front Of Other Sprites
checkbox.comment: Places this Platform in front of other Sprites, making Mario pass through 'behind' it.

list.title: Color
list.entry: Orange if Skinny / Red if Thick
Blue if Skinny / Green if Thick

sprite.name: Peach's Castle - Hint Movie Block Manager
Peach's Castle - Hint Movie Block
sprite.notes: Requires the Hint Movie Block Manager (442) to work.

sprite.name: Swinging Vine - Already Swinging
sprite.notes:
(Unused) Swinging Vine, it starts off swinging slightly. Movement stops after a few seconds.

Yoshi does not work or interact with this sprite.

value.title: Location ID
value.comment: Matches Sprite with a Location to have a thin cloud effect.

sprite.name: Metal Bar
sprite.notes: Other Values are unused, and it was switched to being a static size instead of being 5 high and 2 wide.

sprite.name: Bowser Fireball Spawn Area
sprite.notes: Yoshi does not work or interact with this sprite.

value.title: Location ID
value.comment: The Fireballs will only appear when Mario is in this Location

value.title: Number of Fireballs
value.comment: Changes the number of appearing Fireballs. Value 0 makes 5 Fireballs appear.

value.title: Positioning
value.comment: Changes position the Fireballs appear in. Value "1" seems to CRASH the game.

checkbox.title: Appear
checkbox.comment: The Fireballs will not appear unless this is checked

sprite.name: Enterable Warp Pipe - Up
sprite.notes: This Sprite can be used to create an enterable warp pipe which isn't bound to the normal tile grid.

value.title: Entrance ID
value.comment: The pipe will take the player to this Entrance ID's destination

sprite.name: Scaredy Rat Despawner
sprite.notes: Despawns the Scaredy Rat Sprite when they run through it. It's also used as decoration (will create the 'Mouse Hole').

sprite.name: Bowser Boss Door
sprite.notes: Yoshi does not work or interact with this sprite.

list.title: Orientation
list.comment: (BUGGY) Only use with Rotation Controller (149).

checkbox.title: Rotation Controlled
checkbox.comment: (BUGGY) Glitchy use. Does not work very well if it's 'always spinning'

value.title: Rotation ID
value.comment: Match with a Rotation Controller to cause this Sprite to move.

sprite.name: Ambush Level Controller
sprite.notes: Exact functions unknown.

value.title: Rotation ID
value.comment: Match this Value with a Rotation Controller to make this Sprite move.

sprite.name: Final Boss Bridge Piece
sprite.notes: Falls due to something relating to one of the Final Boss controllers. That behavior cannot be achieved through other means.

value.title: Rotation ID
value.comment: Match this Value with a Rotation Controller to make this Sprite move

value.title: Rotation ID
value.comment: Match this Value with the Rotation Controller to cause the Sprite to move.

sprite.name: Crowd Clapping Controller for Coin Collection #1

value.title: # of Blue Coins in Group
value.comment: Sprite 237

value.title: # of Yellow Coins in Group
value.comment: Sprite 147 - Match Coin ID with Movement ID (May be able to use standard Blocks with this group as well)

value.title: Movement ID
value.comment: Known matches Sprites - Two-Way Controller (260).

list.title: Type
list.comment: 9 Height

sprite.name: Crowd Clapping Controller for Coin Collection #2
sprite.notes: No difference to the other Crowd Clapping Controller. Same functions.

value.title: # of Blue Coins in Group
value.comment: Sprite 237

value.title: # of Yellow Coins in Group
value.comment: Sprite 147 - Match Coin ID with Movement ID (May be able to use standard Blocks with this group as well)

value.title: Coin ID
value.comment: Class name uses "_Regular", may differ from 459 in some way

sprite.name: Enormous Block with Spikes on Side
sprite.notes: The Sprite's placement represents the upper left corner of the Block.

value.title: Distance Moved
value.comment: In Blocks.

list.title: Spikes (Position)
list.comment:
This controls the size and position of the Spike. Each size has a left and right spike setting.

lift_zen_toge_A_left=18x28
lift_zen_toge_A_right=18x28
lift_zen_toge_B_left=18x16
lift_zen_toge_B_right=18x16
lift_zen_toge_C_left=18x41
lift_zen_toge_C_right=18x41
lift_zen_toge_D_left=18x47
lift_zen_toge_D_right=18x47
lift_zen_toge_E_left=24x31
lift_zen_toge_E_right=24x31

sprite.name: Swinging Vine / Chain
sprite.notes: Yoshi does not work or interact with this sprite.

value.title: Unknown Value 6
value.comment: 0, 1 No visible effect.

sprite.name: Moving Lava Style Iron Block
sprite.notes: Identical to 257, but moves before being jumped on. Was only used in W5-Castle.

sprite.name: Vertical Block Platform with Light Gem
sprite.notes: Functions just like the Moving Lava Block (466), but is limited to move up and down.

list.title: Direction Moved
list.comment: The Light Gem will only shine while the Block 'waits' to return to its original position. Difference between 0-2 and 2-4 was not tested, but it could be that Values 2 or 4 cause the Light Gem to shine on the opposite position.

value.title: Delay Before Movement
value.comment: Value : 2 in seconds of the level's clock.

value.title: Delay Before Return
value.comment: Value : 2 in seconds of the level's clock.

sprite.name: Bolt Controlled Airship Platform
sprite.notes: Used by Nintendo together with the Bolt Controlled Airship Platform Wire (470).

value.title: Bolt ID
value.comment: Must have one to function.

checkbox.title: Moves from Bolt
checkbox.comment: Check this to cause the Sprite to move when the Bolt is spun.

list.title: Width
list.comment: Value + 2

value.title: Bolt ID
value.comment: Must have one

checkbox.title: Moves from Bolt
checkbox.comment: Check this to cause the Sprite to move when the Bolt is spun.

sprite.name: Blue and Orange Pot Platform
sprite.notes: Moves up first and then the same distance downward.

sprite.name: Ice Flow Generator
sprite.notes:
Generates cylindrical Ice Blocks (random size) that slide on the ground to the left. No possibility to change the Direction?

Yoshi does not work or interact with this sprite.

sprite.name: Floating Ice Flow Generator
sprite.notes:
Requires water to look correctly. Generates cylindrical Ice Blocks (random size) that swim on the water surface to the left. No possibility to change the Direction?

Yoshi does not work or interact with this sprite.

sprite.name: Dancing Coin/Block Controller
sprite.notes: This Controller is REQUIRED, if 'Dancing' Coins or Blocks exist in the level. Pair Coins and Blocks with this sprite to make them dance back and forth in tempo with the Music. One per Zone is all that is needed, and it can be placed anywhere in the Zone, though placing it by the first Entrance is recommended.

sprite.name: Path Controlled Ice Flow
sprite.notes: Yoshi does not work or interact with this sprite.

value.title: Node ID
value.comment: Node ID to start at

value.title: Path ID
value.comment: Path ID the Block will follow.

checkbox.title: Wiggling
checkbox.comment: (CHECK) Needs a better description. Will slightly 'wiggle' left and right in short intervals.

list.title: Size
list.comment: (S) 0-15. Changes the Ice Flow's scale.

sprite.name: Flying Wrench
sprite.notes: Also check for a (Camera Related) Value, similar to the Cannons.

checkbox.title: Unknown Value 11
checkbox.comment: Makes it disappear? I don't think so...

sprite.name: Super Guide Block
sprite.notes: Don't use this Block in one of your levels, unless you know how to modify Super Guide Videos (which can only be done by Newer Team atm).

checkbox.title: Glows
checkbox.comment: Used in dark levels like W6-6 A2. May do other unused things, but no one cares. :)

sprite.name: Event Controller - Bowser Switch (Small "!")
sprite.notes:
This Switch may have (more) BUGS. Switch does not activate Red Blocks, as the other !-Switches do. Looks identical like the normal Bowser Switch.

If Yoshi is used: As always, Mario has to get off Yoshi for the sequence to continue.

Yoshi does not work or interact with this sprite.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: If this ID is set, the Switch will only show while this Event ID is activated. Slightly buggy if used with Multi-Use.

checkbox.title: Falls
checkbox.comment: If this is checked, the Switch will be movable by environment stuff, such as dropping down when bricks below it are destroyed, or riding along a conveyor belt

checkbox.title: Loads at Midway
checkbox.comment: If this is checked, the Switch will only show if the level has been started from a midway point

checkbox.title: No Music Interrupt
checkbox.comment: If this is checked, the Music will not be interrupted when the Switch is pressed

list.title: Delay on Multi-Use
list.comment: This will set how long the Switch takes to pop up after the Timer expires on a Multi-Use Switch

sprite.name: Event Controller - Bowser Switch (Large "!")
sprite.notes:
This Switch is incompatible with Multi-Use. It will CRASH the Wii (though Dolphin handles it fine). Also, DO NOT assign this Switch to the SAME Event ID as any other Switch, as that may cause crashing as well. Other than that, the Switch works well.

Yoshi does not work or interact with this sprite.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: If this ID is set, the Switch will only show while this Event ID is activated.

checkbox.title: Falls
checkbox.comment: If this is checked, the Switch will be movable by environment stuff, such as dropping down when bricks below it are destroyed, or riding along a conveyor belt

checkbox.title: Loads at Midway
checkbox.comment: If this is checked, the Switch will only show if the level has been started from a midway point

checkbox.title: No Music Interrupt
checkbox.comment: If this is checked, the Music will not be interrupted when the Switch is pressed

list.title: Delay on Multi-Use
list.comment: This will set how long the Switch takes to pop up after the Timer expires on a Multi-Use Switch

list.title: Usage Mode
list.comment: Multi-Use will CRASH the Wii, but may somehow work with Dolphin.

sprite.name: Morton Spike Pillar
sprite.notes: Requires Boss Controller - Tower Boss (363) set to Morton to function. One Block of the Pillar is visible, then it will move down 9 Blocks and create sparks. This is the only Pillar with an 'Initial Launch Delay'.

value.title: Initial Launch Delay
value.comment: Launch Delay prior to the first move. Nintendo uses 0 and 20. 4 approximates to 1 second of the level's clock.

value.title: Launch Delay
value.comment: Changes the launch Delay after the Pillar reaches its original position again. Affects the Sprite on the second launch. 64 = 1 second of the level's clock. 255 = 4 seconds.

value.title: Return Delay
value.comment: 64 = 1 second of the level's clock.

sprite.name: Final Battle Rubble Block (See Notes)
sprite.notes: Due to a BUG in the game, this Sprite will cause a CRASH if the level doesn't contain Bowser (Sprite 419)!

value.title: Size
value.comment: (S) 0-15. Changes the size of this Sprite. Anything past 2 will CRASH the game.

list.title: Background Type
list.comment: Every Value above 2 will cause the Wii to CRASH.
